Description: Liquid biopsies for cancer patients are minimally invasive and easily obtained throughout the course of disease. Circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA) is a promising indicator of minimal residual disease (MRD) following curative-intent treatment, which identifies patients at an increased risk of relapse who may benefit from further adjuvant therapy. After initial treatment, serial monitoring of ctDNA is a highly sensitive approach to detect tumor recurrence, creating an opportunity for earlier intervention. This session will introduce the Inivata RaDaR, a highly sensitive and specific ctDNA detection test, and present recent data demonstrating the validity and utility of ctDNA testing for MRD and disease recurrence.
